{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enamel lamellae are thin, leaf-like faults that extend from the enamel surface into the enamel. They are not elevations on the outer surface of enamel, nor are they dentinal tubules in enamel. They also do not represent a uniform arrangement of enamel rods. Enamel lamellae are not projections in dentin either.", "answer_choice": "B"}
